title: The Simplest Math Problem No One Can Solve - Collatz Conjecture
description: The Collatz Conjecture is the simplest math problem no one can solve — it's easy enough for almost anyone to understand but nobody has been able to prove it.

title: How Electricity Actually Works
description: Electricity doesn't flow the way you think. This video explores the Poynting vector and how energy actually travels through circuits.

title: The Bizarre Behavior of Rotating Bodies
description: �езнутий intermediate axis theorem explains why spinning objects behave so strangely in space.

title: A Physics Prof Bet Me $10,000 I'm Wrong
description: Can a wind-powered vehicle travel directly downwind faster than the wind? A UCLA physics professor bet me $10,000 that it can't.

title: The Longest-Running Evolution Experiment
description: Richard Lenski's E. coli long-term evolution experiment has been running since 1988 — over 75,000 generations of bacteria.

title: Why No One Has Measured The Speed Of Light
description: Physics assumes the speed of light is the same in all directions, but no one has actually verified this with a one-way measurement.

title: Why Gravity Is NOT A Force
description: General relativity reframes gravity not as a force, but as the curvature of spacetime. Objects in freefall are actually following straight lines through curved space.

title: How The Pandemic Will End
description: Exploring the science of how pandemics end — through herd immunity, vaccination, or the virus evolving to become less deadly.

title: The Man Who Accidentally Killed The Most People In History
description: Thomas Midgley Jr. invented both leaded gasoline and CFCs — two of the most environmentally destructive inventions in history.

title: The Asbestos Problem Is Worse Than You Think
description: Asbestos is still legal in most countries and still widely used. This video explores why it's so dangerous and why we haven't banned it.
